intro: Eriosema rossii, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy underside. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its stems are often hairy and can become woody with age. Eriosema rossii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
